message.content:
cs.LG, cs.GT, cs.AI, cs.MA, cs.SY

The paper presents a new methodology for model-free learning of Nash equilibria for general-sum stochastic games using deep Q-learning. This methodology involves a local linear-quadratic expansion of the stochastic game, which is parametrized by deep neural networks. Therefore, the paper is likely to belong to the following arXiv CS sub-categories:

- cs.LG (Machine Learning): The paper proposes a new deep Q-learning methodology for model-free learning of Nash equilibria for general-sum stochastic games. This methodology involves the use of deep neural networks to parametrize a local linear-quadratic expansion of the stochastic game. Therefore, the paper is likely to be relevant to the machine learning community.
- cs.GT (Computer Science and Game Theory): The paper deals with the problem of learning Nash equilibria for general-sum stochastic games. Therefore, the paper is likely to be relevant to the game theory community.
- cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence): The paper proposes a new methodology for model-free learning of Nash equilibria for general-sum stochastic games using deep Q-learning. Therefore, the paper is likely to be relevant to the artificial intelligence community.
- cs.MA (Multiagent Systems): The paper deals with the problem of learning Nash equilibria for multi-agent stochastic games. Therefore, the paper is likely to be relevant to the multiagent systems community.
- cs.SY (Systems and Control):
